SENT.plain: Differentiation of Behçet's disease from the cryptogenic enteropathies can raise diagnostic and nosological problems
The segments of the digestive tract most commonly involved in Behçet's disease are the ileum and colon; rectal manifestations are exceedingly rare
We report six Behçet's disease patients who had rectitis with clinical and histological features reminiscent of ulcerative colitis
Immunopathological differences between the two diseases have been reported by other investigators
